column4: hey guys, did anybody update their linux boxes last night and suddenly have no connection? My work laptop (wireless) and desktop (wired) wont get an address now...
try running dhclient and see if that reconnects you
dink - what, is that a command in terminal?
yes
dink - I got a ton of permission denied
same thing on my laptop too
WTF did ubuntu do with their updates?
I believe you have to run as root/sudo
- excuse me?
- is this a kindergarten hangout here or something?
- I didn't swear. But hey - I appreciate the tip, brosef.
dink - this is weird bro, my desktop is grabbing an IP of .12 and my laptop is grabbing an IP of .10, but the last octet from my router is always 3 digits.
that basically releases/renews your dhcp lease. So whatever your router/switch has free it will give it that address.
dink - that aint makin sense bro, my router supports up to 50 IPs from what I understand, and these 2 machines arent getting them
the only thing I can think of is I updated both machines last night
Is it just those two machines that can't connect on the route ? Are there other machines on the router that do connect ?
dink - this has to be a router thing...
dink - my vista partition is grabbing the .12 IP too...
dink -w onder wt* happened...
dink - it grabs an IP and subnet, but no gateway - gonna go reset the router, thanks for your help bro
good luck
